Description: Rim and neck sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style pottery krater; white slip; interior: black below rim with large red band lined in white; maeander band on top of rim. bars on edge; underside glazed, as is what is preserved of neck.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

In ink 'NAU 1' on break (accession number used in clay analysis). According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p.80 NAU1), the geochemical characteristics of the fabric point to an origin in the region of Teos. For parallels, see Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA6, Bristol H2016.01, and Oxford 1912.35(A).
Bibliographic references: Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78, 80, 82-83, fig. 1) (NAU 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.483)
